questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters (NTO) needs to create a sendable data extension that will contain its customers' information. NTO's customers are identified by a unique alphanumeric Customer ID, and Email Address is a required field.
How should the data extension be configured?

comments.content: Subscriber ID is used internally by SFMC for database operations, it's not typically visible or used in most user interfaces or day-to-day operations.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
it should relate to "Subscriber Key" which is what marketing cloud uses as unique ID which is used in All Subscribers List.Relating the Customer ID to the Subscriber Key ensures that the unique identifier (Customer ID) for each customer in the data extension corresponds to the unique identifier (Subscriber Key) in the All Subscribers list. This is crucial for tracking and managing subscriber activities and preferences across different sends and campaigns.

Selected Answer: C
Should be C

questions.question_text: Which three options can be configured when running this report? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ACD
When running a report in Marketing Cloud, the following three options can typically be configured:
A. Date range parameters
C. Report results delivery location
D. Report results file format
Explanation:
- A. Date range parameters: You can specify the time period for which you want to run the report, allowing you to focus on specific dates.
- C. Report results delivery location: You can choose where the report results will be delivered, such as an email address or an FTP location.
- D. Report results file format: You can select the format in which the report results will be generated, such as CSV, Excel, or PDF.
Why not the other options?
- B. Error handling parameters: This is not typically a configurable option when running standard reports.
- E. Error report log location: While error logs might be generated, specifying their location is not a common configuration option for standard report generation.

A for setting time period
b to replace empty values
c to select filetype format

questions.question_text:
A customer is planning to redesign the company website and email design. As part of the email updates, the company plans to keep its logo in the header and start using preheader text.
What two additional best practices could be applied to the company's new email design? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
You don't want to suddenly look COMPLETELY different to subscribers from one day to another. Upgrade the branding but gradually. If Coca-cola sent me an email with a green background instead of the red one, I would have questions and definitely treat that email with a grain of salt. Bottom line is you don't want to brutally flip branding on your customers, especially within the email. They still need hints it is still you.
BC is answer. Good CTA improve website visits

Selected Answer: BC
Why do you want to keep old branding? answer is clearly B&C
B and C, D will create confusion

choices.C: Corresponding call-to-action included in primary message
choices.A: Use of emojis in preheader text
choices.D: A mix of old branding with new branding
